page.title: 04The River Deben-an overview.
page.content: Through Woodbridge runs a river called the river Deben.Along the banks are several sheds where they build and repair boats and paint them.There are all sorts of boats on the river _ sailing boats , rowing boats , yachts, motor boats and a ferry boat that runs over to Sutton Hoo on the opposite bank.There is a tide mill which runs by tide power.People can go into it and see how it works now it has been restored to working order.You can see a lot of wildlife such as wild flowers, birds and animals .There is also a model yacht pond on which you sail boats. Near the yacht pond there is a park called the Kingston playing field which has swings and slides. There are two cafes in which you can buy refreshments.The River Deben is very popular for sailing,walking or just relaxing. {County Primary.}
